sentences.sentence: Russian President Vladimir Putin is due to meet his Turkish counterpart Recep Tayyip Erdogan on Monday over resuming the Black Sea grain deal.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_05
sentences.sentence: During a first papal visit to Mongolia, Pope Francis delivers a message to the noble people of neighbouring China.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_05
sentences.sentence: Over 2 million children have been displaced in Africa due to climate change.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_05
sentences.sentence: That's according to NGOs Save the Children.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_05
sentences.sentence: Fresh from a hat-trick against Al-Ityad, Serbian Al-Hilal striker Alexander Mitrovic tells Euronews why the best from the Saudi Pro League is still yet to come. Russian President Vladimir Putin and his Turkish counterpart Recep Tayyip Erdogan will meet

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_05
sentences.sentence: Monday to discuss the resumption of grain shipments from Ukraine through the Black Sea, an agreement Moscow broke in July.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_05
sentences.sentence: The Kremlin says it could only return to the deal if restrictions on its grain exports are met.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_05
sentences.sentence: The announcement comes shortly after Kyiv said it endured a three-hour Russian drone barrage against port infrastructure in the Odessa region early Sunday morning.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_05
sentences.sentence: The attack along the Reni seaport saw two people hospitalized, according to Ukrainian officials.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_05
sentences.sentence: The word from Ankara is that reviving the deal to ship Ukrainian grain across the Black Sea is critical for food security, Foreign Minister Hakan Fidan said Thursday.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_05
sentences.sentence: is critical for food security, Foreign Minister Hakan Fidan said Thursday. Turkey has been an ongoing mediator between both Ukraine and Russia during the war and wants the deal to resume as part of broader peace talks.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_05
sentences.sentence: On Sunday, Pope Francis sent a special greeting to the people of China, addressing them at the end of a mass celebrated in Mongolia during a papal visit.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_01
sentences.sentence: Francis led Hong Kong's current Bishop Emeritus, Cardinal John Hong Tong, and Cardinal-elect Stephen Chow to the altar, holding their hands as they sent a message to the Chinese people. In this, I ask to be good Christians and good citizens.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_05
sentences.sentence: Unlike China, Mongolia has a tradition of religious tolerance.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_05
sentences.sentence: Beijing and its Communist Party has been waiting a years-long sweeping crackdown on religion, tightening controls, especially on Christianity and Islam, that are viewed as foreign imports and potential challengers to Communist authority.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_05
sentences.sentence: Running for cover in central Spain.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_05
sentences.sentence: Sunday's heavy downpours have led authorities to introduce flooding protocols, shut down train lines and even cancel a La Liga football match.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_05
sentences.sentence: Text messages were sent to Madrid residents with instructions to stay at home and to avoid using cars.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_05
sentences.sentence: It is expected that the Spanish capital's record rainfall from 1972 of 87 litres per square metre would most likely be broken. The forecast of intense rain is a stark comparison to Spain's high temperatures in August.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_05
sentences.sentence: Climate change is a reality and affecting planet earth in different ways.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_05
sentences.sentence: Children in particular are suffering severely from natural disasters.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_05
sentences.sentence: This is the warning by the non-governmental organization Save the Children.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_05
sentences.sentence: More than 2 million children in sub-Saharan Africa became internally displaced due to climate events in 2022.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_05
sentences.sentence: Forced displacement nearly doubled from 1 million in 2021 to a record 1.85 million.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_05
sentences.sentence: According to Save the Children's last report, thousands of children will never return home, living much of their childhood in refugee camps with their families or in temporary locations.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_08
sentences.sentence: Malama Mwila, one of the NGO's regional heads, is calling on world leaders to change this picture.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_08
sentences.sentence: MALAMA MWILA, Regional Head, Global North, World Leaders When it comes to actually implementing and providing these funds, there's been little action that has happened.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_08
sentences.sentence: So the political commitment, especially from the global north, has been lacking.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_08
sentences.sentence: We want to see more actions from these governments that have been, you know, emitting historically and contributing largely to the climate crisis. So that's where we want to see action, more action and less talk.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_05
sentences.sentence: This week marks the start of Africa Climate Week, where policymakers, business and civil society need to discuss climate solutions ahead of COP28, which will take place later this year in Dubai.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_06
sentences.sentence: The starting point will be how to deal with the natural catastrophes that plagued Africa.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_05
sentences.sentence: The continent has the youngest population on the planet and possesses the Congo Basin forests, better known as the lungs of the world.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_09
sentences.sentence: It's bringing on board is not just to talk about the problems, but also to talk about the solutions and the solutions in which Africa is already preferring and actually putting in place to be able to share those lessons with the entire world.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_09
sentences.sentence: Climate change is a shared risk.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_09
sentences.sentence: As we're speaking today, there are wildfires in Canada that are burning and destroying ecosystems in Canada. There are floods in Europe, in some parts are burning and destroying ecosystems in Canada.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_09
sentences.sentence: There are floods in Europe, in some parts of Europe and in China.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_09
sentences.sentence: Climate change is a shared risk, meaning that no one is immune and it doesn't respect territorial integrity.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_09
sentences.sentence: It is affecting everyone, whether the people are in rich or poor countries.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_09
sentences.sentence: Because of the fact that climate change is affecting everyone, it needs everyone to be on board with the solutions.

sentences.sentence: The room went silent when Mario Laginia

sentences.sentence: started playing at the Estoril conferences.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_06
sentences.sentence: As one of the most famous Portuguese jazz musicians, he was one of the speakers taking the stage to explore how music can be a lifesaver.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_06
sentences.sentence: Sometimes I hear people that are experts in the economy and they talk about numbers, numbers, numbers.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_03
sentences.sentence: And sometimes I said, let's talk about people, because the numbers can come from people working or people not working or working well or not well.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_06
sentences.sentence: A more humanised world, that is the focus of the 2023 ESSER conferences with discussions ranging from the impact of AI to the war in Ukraine. A common objective can be found in uniting for a positive change.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_06
sentences.sentence: I think that the European solidarity is doing great so far but it's not a given fact because keeping not only European solidarity but also transatlantic solidarity is the sine qua no for our joint victory in the future. With the presence of Nobel laureates, politicians, scientists and environmentalists, the conference delved into some of the most pressing challenges the world is facing, allowing young generations to engage with these issues.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_07
sentences.sentence: There are so many people from so many different branches, sciences coming here, and I feel like it's an opportunity to learn not only about what's already being explored, but what's already coming in the future.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_06
sentences.sentence: As the conferences came to an end, one certainty remained.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_06
sentences.sentence: Acting now for the future is more urgent than ever.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_06
sentences.sentence: Joan Bodigny, Euronews.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_05
sentences.sentence: Gondolas and boats take part in Venice's historical regatta throughout the lagoon area.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_05
sentences.sentence: The Venice regatta is one of the oldest events held in the lagoon. It begins with a ceremonial parade along the Grand Canal of historical boats manned by Venetians in period costume.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_05
sentences.sentence: The most important rowing races are between the various neighbourhoods of Venice.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_05
sentences.sentence: In the past, the regattas were divided in challenges among boatmen and big regattas.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_05
sentences.sentence: Red Bull Formula One driver Max Verstappen wins the Italian Grand Prix in Monza, beating Sergio Perez to surpass Sebastian Vettel's F1 record for most consecutive wins.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_05
sentences.sentence: Verstappen eclipses a record set by Vettel in 2013. Sergio Perez fought hard to make it a Red Ball one-two, while Carlos Sanz just held off Charles Leclerc in the final laps to take third place. The result means Verstappen is still on top for the 2023 series. Fernando Alonso remains in third, despite finishing ninth in Monza.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_05
sentences.sentence: The transfer market in Europe has closed on Friday but the wealthy Saudi league can still sign players until September 7th. After scoring a memorable hat-trick in the Saudi Clasico, Al-Halal striker Alexander Mitrovic tells Euronews about his experience and the fascination with the Saudi league.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_00

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_05
sentences.sentence: Two Americans made history in the Dacia UTMB Mont Blanc, Ultramarathon and Chamonix.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_05
sentences.sentence: Jim Wamsley won the 20th edition's men's competition in a time of 9 hours 37 minutes and 43 seconds.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_05
sentences.sentence: Fellow American Zack Miller came second and Frenchman Germain Granger third respectively.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_05
sentences.sentence: He is the first American to ever win the men's event.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_05
sentences.sentence: In the women's competition Courtney DeWalter's win completed the American double at a time of 23 hours 29 minutes and 14 seconds.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_05
sentences.sentence: The win at Mont Blanc is her third after the 2019 and 2021 titles.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_05
sentences.sentence: Katharina Hartmut of Germany and French competitor Blondine L. Erondelle finished second and third.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_05
sentences.sentence: Two and a half thousand people entered the spectacular 171-kilometre race through France, Italy and Switzerland.
